overview: This report investigates the alleged misappropriation of US$12,000 intended as Daily Subsistence Allowance (DSA) for five conference participants by a staff member of the Economic Commission for Africa (ECA) in Seychelles. Additional documentation revealed complex handling of funds totaling US$49,000. The ACGD Officer was involved in handling various cash sums for expenses and DSA payments, with bank and UNDP staff witnessing transactions.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Staff members shall not use their office or knowledge gained from their official functions for private gain.
Officials to whom cash advances are issued shall be held personally accountable and financially liable.
Disbursements shall be recorded in the accounts as at the date on which they are made.

methodology.description: The investigation involved reviewing initial complaints, conducting preliminary investigations, and onsite evaluations during an ECA mission.
documents_reviewed: List of participants for the Seychelles conference

background.context: An investigation into the allegations that a staff member from ECA misappropriated funds designated for DSA for a conference in Seychelles.
timeline: 2001-01-01;2005-12-31: Preliminary investigation and onsite evaluation during ECA mission
1999-02-15;1999-02-18: Conference at Berjaja Mahe Beach Resort Hotel, Victoria, Seychelles
2000-03-08: Confirmation letter from Official 7 in Mauritius

allegations.description: Misappropriation of US$12,000 in DSA for conference participants in Seychelles.
allegations.findings: Further analysis found US$49,000 was meant for DSA and expenses, with discrepancies in payments. Cancelling of PT.8 forms and potential bank employee tampering noted.

allegations.description: Handling of DSA by ACGD Officer and Barclays representatives.
allegations.findings: Significant sums handled by ACGD Officer, with DSA distributed by bank officials and UNDP Liaison Officer present. Conflicting accounts about PT.8 forms and attendance issues were found.

allegations.description: Discrepancies in attendee registration and DSA distribution during the conference.
allegations.findings: Participant 3 did not attend, and Barclays possibly paid some attendees. Discrepancies existed in attendance records and DSA totals.

allegations.description: Potential unrecorded funds and acknowledgment of misappropriation by the ACGD Officer.
allegations.findings: ACGD Officer initially denied full sum receipt, later acknowledged receipt of US$22,000 and additional US$28,627, as confirmed by bank records.

findings: The ACGD Officer failed to account for US$3,011, besides his claims against Barclays.
The Officer admitted receiving a significant amount of funds and acknowledged discrepancies in processing.

violations.excerpt: Staff members shall not use their office or knowledge gained from their official functions for private gain.
Officials to whom cash advances are issued shall be held personally accountable and financially liable.

actions: Appropriate action be taken against the ACGD Officer for breaching Financial Rule 104.9 and 104.10 (b) and (c).
ECA management review its cash disbursement practices to identify additional gaps and learn lessons to avoid similar future problems.
